util.spring.io

Interface ResourceReader<T>


  • public interface ResourceReader<T>
    Converts resource data into instances of T.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.stream.Stream<T> convert(java.io.InputStream data)
      Converts the resource data into instances of T.
      default java.util.stream.Stream<T> readResource(java.util.Optional<org.springframework.core.io.Resource> data)
      Reads the resource input stream and converts the data into objects if a resource is present; otherwise just returns an empty stream.
      default java.util.stream.Stream<T> readResource(org.springframework.core.io.Resource data)
      Convenience method, same as the other readResource but it accepts a straight resource.

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        java.util.stream.Stream<T> convert(java.io.InputStream data)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Converts the resource data into instances of T.
        Parameters:
        data - the resource data.
        Returns:
        the data in the input stream as instances of T; the returned stream will be empty or null if the input stream was empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an I/O or data conversion error occurs.

      • readResource

        default java.util.stream.Stream<T> readResource(org.springframework.core.io.Resource data)
        Convenience method, same as the other readResource but it accepts a straight resource. This method is defaulted to call the other readResource method.
        Parameters:
        data - the resource to read from.
        Returns:
        the resource data as T's or an empty stream as the case may be, but never null.

      • readResource

        default java.util.stream.Stream<T> readResource(java.util.Optional<org.springframework.core.io.Resource> data)
        Reads the resource input stream and converts the data into objects if a resource is present; otherwise just returns an empty stream. An empty stream will also be returned if the data conversion resulted in a null, e.g. if the resource stream was empty. Any exception raised will be wrapped in a runtime ResourceReadException and re-thrown as such. This method is defaulted to carry out all the above using the convert method.
        Parameters:
        data - the resource to read from.
        Returns:
        the resource data as T's or an empty stream as the case may be, but never null.
        Throws:
        ResourceReadException - to wrap any exception that was raised when attempting to read the resource input stream and convert the data into objects.
